sentence.Network_en: The whole area has been shocked by the desecration of the cemetery.
sentence.Network_cn: 对墓地的亵渎震惊了整个地区。

sentence.Network_en: Desecration, and so forth, and lectured you on dignity and sanctity.
sentence.Network_cn: 比如亵渎神圣等.想用尊严和神圣不可侵犯之类的话来打动你们.

sentence.Network_en: Desecration: will no longer break stealth.
sentence.Network_cn: 亵渎: 不再消除潜行.

I desecrated a pure heart., 我亵渎了一个纯真的心灵.

entry.tran: 亵渎，玷污(神圣或特别的事物)
entry.def: If someone desecrates something which is considered to be holy or very special, they deliberately damage or insult it.

example.ex: She shouldn't have desecrated the picture of a religious leader...
example.tran: 她不该亵渎宗教领袖的画像。

example.ex: The earth is to be honoured; it is not to be desecrated.
example.tran: 大地应该受到敬仰，而不该被亵渎。

means.word_mean: 1. blasphemous behavior; the act of depriving something of its sacred character;

auth_sentence.content: Desecration is the first resort of the provocateur.
